title: Michelle Keegan and Mark Wright enjoy romantic Dubai getaway
text:
No, you’re jealous (Picture: Michelle Keegan)

Michelle Keegan and Mark Wright have been enjoying some well-earned time to themselves as they jetted off to Dubai for a romantic getaway.

The sweet couple have been giving everyone major travel envy as they shared gorgeous snaps from the holiday.

While Mark could be seen enjoying a beer in the pool and dubbing himself a ‘f***ing superhero’ as he gave the Avengers: Endgame viral video trend his own take, Michelle looked to be taking things easy on the beach.

‘Just missing a Mojito,’ she wrote as she posed among palm trees on the sand, before beaming in front of the famous Burj al Arab, with the pair enjoying a romantic evening drink at the landmark.

The couple, who have been married since 2015, have been enjoying time together after they opened up about the long-distance period of their marriage.

Advertisement

Soon after they tied the knot, they were forced to spend time apart when Michelle filmed in Malaysia for Our Girl, while her Towie beau got a presenting job in LA.

During an appearance on The Jonathan Ross Show, she told the host: ‘We were apart for about four months. It was really tough. People said, “How did you deal with it?” and stuff.

The star posed away with the landmarks (Picture: @michkeegan)

‘Thank God for FaceTime and things like that.’

Meanwhile, she revealed that she’s in no rush to have kids just yet – but she does want them in future.

Who can blame her if she wants to enjoy a few tropical getaways first?

Not too shabby (Picture: @michkeegan)

With the star looking stunning in a her bikini, Mark also recently stuck up for his wife against cruel body-shamers.

Former Towie star Mark explained: ‘I posted a picture of us last week and underneath in the comments one of them said, “Michelle, you need to eat”.

‘But she does eat. I see her eat. She works bloody hard to get that body. I see her at the gym running and sweating, so people haven’t got the right to say that’, he told his sister Jess Wright’s Girls No Filter podcast.
